title: places.sqlite is imcomplete
content:
Hello,

I used my firefox account to restore my browsing history after I switched to a new hard drive. I compared the contents of places.sqlite from before and after the switch. (I can do this because I made a backup of the old places.sqlite.) And I noticed that many entries of moz_historyvisits are missing in the new database. I made a graph about this, in which I am using pythons sqlite3 library to inspect the databases moz_historyvisits.visit_date column. For every visit_date I checked if it is still present in the new database or if it got lost. The pattern seems highly irregular.

Does firefox intend to maintain a complete history? By which criteria did individual history entries get lost? Is there a way to restore a complete version of my browser history from my account?

Any help is appreciated.
creator: garrettmay

title: With YOUR "collective" HELP, I was able to recover my BOOKMARKS, but now, FIREFOX ...
content:
Firefox is making itself a "pain..." again. It is now unhappy I am using an OLD PROFILE and wants me to use/go to a new one.

Your advice? Of course I hesitate as going to rel 87.0 got me into this trouble in the first place by losing EVERYTHING and forcing me to create a new profile, while "hiding" everything and started me from scratch. So now again, "I hesitate". I am almost 84 yo and I cant keep trying to recover FIREFOX bookmarks, add-ons...history.. keeps losing with every release.

Your advice? TRY to get at least, the bookmarks I recovered to a "new" profile or ignore FIREFOX and keep using my old working profile? Anyone find a way to "recover" lost ONETAB URL's?
creator: jagman55

title: FYI to all... FF87.0 update broke my ability to logon to financial sites... Fixed today by NFCU update...
content:
My Navy Federal Credit Union did a major update to their system today 04/07/2021. After the update I was no longer prevented from logging on w/FF87.0 private window. Saw others having many problems similar to mine & you might mention to them that FF87.0 may now be more advanced than the various systems that they are not able to login to after the FF87.0 update. I was using MSEdge to access my blocked sites & almost went back to FF86.0.1.

Problems with Youtube full screen not working persist. Could be a spyware tool embedded by Google that is broken now. Not a big enough problem to force me to roll back version of FF. Saw many others were having online video problems since update. I don't have an answer for them.

Guessing as privacy protection increases our access problems will also increase as hacks, spies & adware try to battle back. Me? I like my privacy & thank Mozilla folks for their great work. God bless one & all. Stay safe.
creator: dotsondd

title: Recently installed metamask on firefox. Today had to have FFox password (not MM)reset.Now MM wallet gone.
content:
Recently I added a Meta Mask extension on Fire Fox. Invested a few hundred dollars in a crypto. Then today I reset my Fire Fox password. Now the Meta mask sidebar icon gone. Trying to logon to Meta Mask, my Meta Mask password was invalid. Tried to get a new one but message was they had no account with that email address.

I have the restore list. Can that be used? If so how? Is there another way tor restore?

I imagine you have my email address, but just to be sure: moicheozick@hotmail.com
creator: moicheozick

title: The online game does not work properly, the full screen does not work
content: The online game is not working properly, the full screen is not working! I play a free online game on Firefox. It used to work well, but when the game stopped using Flash - there were problems. (I'm also announced the maintenance of the game, but maybe the problem is also in Firefox) This is a Kizi game called Royal Story. It is a free online game where you build a kingdom and perform tasks there. (Kizi.com/games/royal-story) Really fun! You will not see the game on the page completely, but will need to turn on full screen mode in the game's internal settings. That full screen no longer works, the game can’t be seen in full, and playing is really hard. Does Firefox and game maintenance need to fix this together, or is this some adjustment that the player can influence? ... Nettipeli ei toimi kunnolla, koko näyttö tila ei toimi ! Pelaan ilmaista nettipeliä Firefoxilla. Aikaisemmin se toimi hyvin, mutta kun peli lopetti Flashin käytön - tuli ongelmia. ( Olen ilmoittanut myös pelin ylläpitoon, mutta ehkä ongelma on myös Firefoxissa ) Kyseessä on Kizin peli nimeltä Royal Story. Se on ilmainen nettipeli, jossa rakennetaan kuningaskuntaa ja suoritetaan siellä tehtäviä. ( Kizi.com/games/royal-story ) Tosi hauskaa! Et näe peliä sivulla kokonaan, vaan pitää laittaa päälle täysi näyttö tila pelin sisäisistä asetuksista. Tuo täysi näyttö ei enää toimi, peliä ei saa näkymään kokonaan ja pelaaminen on tosi vaikeaa. Pitääkö Firefoxin ja pelin ylläpidon korjata tämä yhdessä vai onko tämä joku säätö mihin pelaaja voi vaikuttaa?
creator: PurpleLady

title: Mozilla Firefox account -- lost access to primary email and requires authentication to switch to my registered secondary address
content:
Hello,

I have lost access to the primary email on my account. I will never be able to get it back, it was a work email address from a previous employer.

I had already registered a secondary email address but it won't let me switch it to primary without confirmation to the current primary address. Is there a way around this issue, or am I stuck with my account set permanently to a dead inbox?
creator: darrell.bunger

title: MSEdge, Why Is it Allowed to Get My Mozilla PW's fm FireFox ?
content:
Ok. So i have never ever used MS Edge for logging into FireFox and Mozilla accounts. But low and behold, MSEdge now has these Login and PW's for these accounts.

I had brought up this observation, in the recent past, regarding how MSEdge aggregated all my logins and pw's from FireFox. And the response was for me to use a Master Password.

But this isnt the solution or the issue at hand.

The concern is why does Edge believe it is entitled to aggregate my FireFox PW's? And when does it do so? And how does it tap into the encrypted FF files? Yet, Edge has not aggregated the bookmarks in FF.

Something is not right nor ethical.

Interestingly, perhaps FireFox users that lose their logins and passwords in FireFox browser can tap into MSEdge to restore them? Seems like a reasonable solution.
creator: databaseben
